channel.title: Allowing Batch
channel.description:
I have a suggestion to allow batch, Im not here to be flamed, just a small suggestion. I myself am great at batch, but I cant share any of my knowlege here because it is banned, Im hoping this thread gives enough reasoning to allow batch topics. Here is the rule posted by a moparscape staff member:
I think it's time there has been enough useless batch threads in the section, especially when there is sites to use such as: Windows XP Commands - SS64.com Command line reference - Microsoft.com Please, stop posting Batch topics as all that is needed is a look on either of the above sites. If Batch topics are posted, they will become locked.
My first point is the fact that he said:
especially when there is sites to use such as: Windows XP Commands - SS64.com Command line reference - Microsoft.com
because in that case, Ban Java because theres this site to go to http://java.sun.com/docs/codeconv/ Ban Delphi because theres this site to look at: http://delphi.about.com/od/beginners/a/delphicourse.htm And Ban Visual Basic because youve got this Whole Forum: http://www.maxvb.com/ and lastly, Im not even going to post a site because we all know there are tons: Ban C(*) Coding. All programming languages have websites where you can get usefull information. My second point, I understand Batch isnt exactly a popular syntax to use, but its good to know some of it, just like java and some other stuff. Im great at Batch and I can help tons of people on Mitb and Mpscp. All im asking for is to allow some batch into the forum because knowledge wise, it wont hurt. Thanks for reading, Matrix Pride (Jon) P.S. Also Whats wrong with having some batch stuff posted?

item.title: Allowing Batch

item.description:
@Matrix_Revoked wrote:

you guys arent geting my point, im not argueing for batch to get its own topic and come back, im ASKING for batch to be able to be posted, im not saying its a language because its not, im not saying i didnt agree to the forum rules and btw I joined about 8months ago, but I was IP banned for being called a nigger and replying back by thug life. Lets not get into that. ANYWAYS, I see you people are not up for reasoning with your rules, this place has a king and queen no people. BYE AND YES YOU ARE ALL MPSCPERS

Read full topic

item.title: Allowing Batch
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Matrix Revoked:

Oh please, cheese police. One, Wikipedia is the most unreliable source of information. any person can change the content and have it accepted by a dum administrator tha doesnt know what the user is talking about. One, Im not a little idiot posting little compilers all over the place. Compilers are as easy as 5 lines on a batch file. Im talking about large batch files that help do diffrent things like run programs, delete files that couldnt be deleted manually and other things directory wise, Computer using batch, not dumb RSPS Batch omg lookz at mii Epix Compil3r.

en.wikipedia.org

Reliability of Wikipedia

The reliability of Wikipedia (predominantly of the English-language edition) has been frequently questioned and often assessed. The reliability has been tested statistically, through comparative review, analysis of the historical patterns, and strengths and weaknesses inherent in the editing process unique to Wikipedia. Incidents of conflicted editing, and the use of Wikipedia for 'revenge editing' (inserting false, defamatory or biased statements into biographies) have attracted publicity.[2

Aside from that, you can do nothing with Batch but manipulate Windows, which you shouldn’t have in the first place…

Read full topic

item.title: Allowing Batch

item.title: Allowing Batch
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Apart from agreeing with every post in this thread that shot you down I’d like to add, anyone with a reasonable amount of experience wont be using batch to compile things. I just use the command line, or most IDE’s have a “Build” button now-a-days anyway.

Batch is not a programming language, or a scripting language. Therefore it has no place within the programming boards here. If your argument is that it is useful to an extent and should be allowed to be posted, my argument is it doesn’t fit within any section of this site, has no relevance to this site and is not worthy of its own board.

Whose argument wins…? Mine, always.

I was also quite intrigued how moparscapers have picked up on “mscpers” being used as an insult and have started lashing it back at us. The problem there hunny, is that you can’t have a Jewish guy going round calling people Jews. It doesn’t work… it’s like Paris Hilton calling someone a slut.

Read full topic

item.title: Allowing Batch
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Matrix Revoked:

One, Wikipedia is the most unreliable source of information. any person can change the content and have it accepted by a dum administrator tha doesnt know what the user is talking about.

As unreliable as wikipedia can potentially be, it more often than not provides quite reasonable insight into topics.

Matrix Revoked:

One, Im not a little idiot posting little compilers all over the place. Compilers are as easy as 5 lines on a batch file.

Don’t you mean ‘Two’? More to the point though, the remark about compilers being a 5 line batch file says it all.

To cut what could be a long reply short, we don’t need to justify our rules (which have been in place long before you joined, which, for the record, was little more than a month ago).
You agreed to abide by all forum rules before having the ability to view the forum - this topic, which you created, is testament to the fact that you agreed to them, as creating a topic requires registration, registration requires the ability to view the forums, and the ability to view the forums requires you to agree to follow our rules.
It’s that simple.

Read full topic
